results.title: Beethoven or boogie?
results.brief_description: An appreciation of music is instilled in a Youth Club; the members form a Music Group and give a concert to raise money to purchase a radiogram. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven and his music
results.brief_description: The music of Beethoven reflects the great social upheaval of the late eighteenth century, the composer’s own unusual strength and genius and the transition from the classic formality of Haydn and Mozart to more romantic expression. The film develops the relationships between Beethoven’s environment and his personal response to it in terms of his music. Excerpts from the following are included in the film. First and Fourth Movement of the Symphony No. 5; The First Movement of the Violin Sonata, Opus 12 no. 2; the First Movement of the Archduke Trio, Opus 97; the First Movement of the Symphony No. 3 “Eroica”; the Piano Sonata No.14, Opus 27, No. 2 “Moonlight”; and the First Movement of the Symphony no. 6 “Pastoral”; the First Movement of the Piano Concerto No. 5 “Emperor”. No other credits available.

results.title: Beethoven
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre and Anvil Films and Record Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Composers”.
This film deals with Beethoven’s music up to 1806. John Ogden at the piano plays the “Appassionata” from the “Tempest Sonata” and with Brenda Lucas the early “Sonata for four hands”. Von Karajan conducts Symphony no. 3 (the “Eroica”) op. 55 and the Gabrielli Quartet plays “Rasoumoffsky Quartet” no.2 op.59.

results.title: Beef, grass and dairy calves
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to farmers the new techniques of calf rearing which can be successfully incorporated into existing farming systems. It underlines the higher productivity and therefore greater profitability which results from the new methods when and if they are used.

results.title: Beech foresters
results.brief_description: This film reviews the extent and nature of beech forests in New Zealand and describes schemes undertaken for improvement. Draws attention to the work of the New Zealand Forest Service in carrying out aerial and ground surveys and compiling information, resulting in such schemes as the erection of deer-proof fences, selection of seed trees and the establishment of even age forests. Describes the uses to which timber is put. No other credits available.

results.title: The Bedspread
results.creator_credit: Natalie Green, Elizabeth O'Neill and Berry St Film Productions
results.brief_description: Concerns two poverty-stricken women, Mrs Clancy and Mrs Parsons, living in Melbourne during the depression. Mrs Clancy owns a good bedspread, her pride and joy. Mrs Parsons asks to borrow the bedspread in preparation for a visit by a specialist to her sick daughter. This small incident becomes the focal point of the day. Cast includes Janet Robertson, Moira Claux and Kim Deacon. Based on a short story by Iris Simmons.

results.title: Beds and appliances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
This film, produced by the U.S. Navy, demonstrates how to make and manipulate beds for the sick and injured (particularly those bedridden for extended periods of time) so that the patient’s comfort is increased and their recovery is thereby quickened. Demonstrates how to make a bunk as well as a bed in a ward so that the bedclothes do no need adjusting during the day, and also includes handy tips for materials which can be used to improvise elevations and inclines to vary a patient’s position in bed. No other credits available.

results.title: Bedouins of Arabia
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of Bedouin tribesmen in the Arabian desert, noting their relationships with each other and with the land. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.
